DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Erythrocyte Mean Corpuscular Volume Outcome Upper Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for quantitative measurement of the mean volume of erythrocytes in a biological specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Erythrocyte Mean Corpuscular Volume Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result a quantitative measurement of the mean volume of erythrocytes in a biological specimen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A quantitative measurement of the mean volume of erythrocytes in a biological specimen.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The mean cell volume is the average volume of a red blood cell. This is a calculated value derived from the hematocrit and the red cell count.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Erythrocyte Mean Corpuscular Volume Upper Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for erythrocyte mean corpuscular volume.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
